title: Part 8 - EXECUTIVE ORDERS (ANDREW M. CUOMO), SIGNED FEBRUARY 1, 2021 THROUGH AUGUST 21, 2021
content:
Part 8 - EXECUTIVE ORDERS (ANDREW M. CUOMO), SIGNED FEBRUARY 1, 2021 THROUGH AUGUST 21, 2021

State Regulations
§ 26.1 - Executive Order. No. 26: Statewide Language Access Policy
§ 168.45 - Continuing the Declaration of a Disaster Emergency in the Five Boroughs of New York City and the Counties of Dutchess, Nassau, Orange, Putnam, Rockland, Suffolk and Westchester That Incorporate the MTA Region in the State of New York
§ 198.13 - Continuing the Declaration of Disaster Emergency in the Counties of Cayuga, Jefferson, Monroe, Niagara, Orleans, Oswego, St. Lawrence, and Wayne
§ 202.93 - Continuing Temporary Suspension and Modification of Laws Relating to the Disaster Emergency
§ 209 - Declaring a Disaster in the Counties of Bronx, Dutchess, Kings, Nassau, New York, Orange, Putnam, Queens, Richmond, Rockland, Suffolk, Sullivan, Ulster, Westchester, and Contiguous Counties
§ 210 - Expiration of Executive Orders 202 and 205
§ 211 - Declaration of a State Wide Disaster Emergency Due To Gun Violence
§ 212 - Declaring a Disaster in Steuben County
§ 213 - Declaring a Disaster in the Counties of Bronx, Kings, Nassau, New York, Queens, Richmond, Suffolk, Westchester, Putnam, Rockland, Orange, Dutchess, Sullivan, Columbia, Delaware, Greene, Broome, Chenango, Otsego, Rensselaer, Schoharie, Albany, Montgomery, Schenectady, Saratoga, and Contiguous Counties

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
